articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Palestinians voiced wariness on Tuesday toward a U.S.-backed foundation set to bring aid to Gaza amid signs of famine, with Hamas warnings about biometric screening procedures keeping many away from distribution points.
articles.title: Palestinians wary as US-backed aid group begins operations in Gaza

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: The contacts mark a significant development in ties between the two countries.
articles.title: Exclusive: Syria and Israel in direct talks focused on security, sources say

articles.author: Sarah Marsh, Matthias Williams, Thomas Escritt
articles.description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz delivered his most severe rebuke of Israel to date, criticising massive air strikes on Gaza as no longer justified by the need to fight Hamas and "no longer comprehensible".
articles.title: Germany shifts tone on Israel over 'incomprehensible' Gaza carnage

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: National Public Radio and three Colorado public radio stations are suing the Trump administration over the president's executive order to cut federal funding for public broadcasting, NPR said on Tuesday.
articles.title: NPR sues Trump, says funding cut violates First Amendment

articles.author: Gopal Sharma
articles.description: Ukrainian climber Andrew Ushakov, who completed a journey from sea level to the summit of Mount Everest in a record four days, has been released on bail following his arrest for carrying undeclared foreign currency, a Nepali official told Reuters on Tuesday.
articles.title: Ukrainian climber released from detention days after record-breaking Everest ascent

articles.author: Danial Azhar
articles.description: Southeast Asian leaders reached an understanding on Tuesday that any bilateral agreements they might strike with the United States on trade tariffs would not harm each others' economies, Malaysia's premier Anwar Ibrahim said.
articles.title: ASEAN leaders agree tariff deals with US should not harm members

articles.author: Phil Noble, Sachin Ravikumar
articles.description: Four people were "very, very ill in hospital" after a car ploughed into a crowd of Liverpool fans during a Premier League title parade, the city's mayor said, adding that he hoped they would "pull through."
articles.title: Four people injured in Liverpool parade crash 'very, very ill,' mayor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Europe is in crisis and needs Poland to "wake it up," Polish nationalist presidential candidate Karol Nawrocki said on Tuesday, speaking to the Conservative Political Action Conference in Poland.
articles.title: Europe is in crisis, Polish nationalist presidential candidate tells conservative conference

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: Russian forces have captured four villages in Ukraine's northeastern Sumy region, the local governor said, the latest battlefield setback for Kyiv as it seeks to hold territory and avoid handing Moscow the advantage in any peace talks.
articles.title: Russia seizes villages in northern Ukraine, drone attacks ease

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Two weeks into the sex trafficking trial of Sean Diddy Combs, witnesses have accused the hip-hop mogul of everything from breaking into a rival's home to taking ecstasy and attempting to intimidate or pay off witnesses in the case.
articles.title: Ecstasy and bribery accusations in Sean 'Diddy' Combs trial bolster racketeering charge
